# Tools for visualising amplicon data

ampvis2 is an R-package to conveniently visualise and analyse 16S rRNA amplicon data in different ways.

## Installing ampvis2
First, install [R](https://mirrors.dotsrc.org/cran/) (and for Windows also [RTools](https://mirrors.dotsrc.org/cran/bin/windows/Rtools/)) and [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download). Then open RStudio as administrator (!) and run the 3 commands below to install ampvis2 from the console. If you get asked to update old packages, just hit a. Install missing packages with `biocLite("packagename")`, if any.
```{r, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, eval=FALSE}
install.packages("devtools")
source("http://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R")
biocLite("MadsAlbertsen/ampvis2", dependencies = TRUE)
```

## Get started
For a quick guide on how to use ampvis2 go to [Get Started](https://madsalbertsen.github.io/ampvis2/articles/ampvis2.html) and for details about all ampvis2 functions go to [Reference](https://madsalbertsen.github.io/ampvis2/reference/index.html).

## Shiny
An interactive Shiny app with some of the basic functionality of ampvis2 can be found at: [https://kasperskytte.shinyapps.io/shinyampvis](https://kasperskytte.shinyapps.io/shinyampvis)
